news.Title: Qualcomm in talks with Samsung Electronics for contract manufacturing, South Korean newspaper says
news.Content:
SSNLF

TSLA

SEOUL, Jan 7 (Reuters) - Qualcomm is in talks with Samsung Electronics â€‹over contract manufacturing of two-nanometre â€Œchips, the U.S. company's CEO Cristiano Amon was â€Œquoted by the Korea Economic Daily as saying on Wednesday.
The South Korean paper cited Amon as saying â that Qualcomm was â€Œholding talks first with Samsung Electronics, among several semiconductor â€foundry firms, about contract manufacturing using the latest two-nanometre process, with design work already â€‹completed for commercialisation in the â€Œnear future.

Qualcomm was not immediately available for comment outside regular business hours. Samsung Electronics said it did not comment on specific customers.
Samsung Electronics' co-CEO â and chip chief, Jun â€‹Young-hyun, said last â€‹week that recent supply deals with major customers had left its â€loss-making foundry â business "primed for a great leap forward". Samsung Electronics signed a $16.5 billion â deal with Tesla in July.
(Reporting by Heekyong â€ŒYang and Jihoon Lee. Editing â€Œby Mark Potter)

news.Title: 1 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock to Buy Before It Soars 140% to Join Nvidia and Tesla as a Trillion-Dollar Company
news.Content:
NVDA

TSLA

Key Points Tech analyst Dan Ives says Palantir will be a trillion-dollar company within a year or two; that implies 140% upside from its current market value.
Palantir is a leader in AI decisioning software and its revenue growth has accelerated in nine consecutive quarters.
Palantir currently trades at more than 100 times sales; every other software stock that has reached that level has eventually fallen at least 65%.
10 stocks we like better than Palantir Technologies â€º

Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) stock generated triple-digit returns in 2024 and 2025. The data analytics company is currently worth $415 billion, but Wedbush analyst Dan Ives says the stock can climb 140% in the next year or two, such that the company achieves a trillion-dollar market value.
That would put Palantir in rarefied air. Only 10 U.S. companies, including Nvidia and Tesla , are worth at least $1 trillion. Most Wall Street analysts are less bullish; the stock has a median target price of $200 per share, which implies 15% upside from the current share price of $174.
Unfortunately, history says owning Palantir is incredibly risky. Here are the important details.
Palantir is a leader in artificial intelligence decisioning platforms Palantir helps customers across the public and private sectors manage and make sense of complex data. Its analytics software products, Gotham and Foundry, integrate information into an ontology, a decision-making framework powered by machine learning (ML) models that become increasingly proficient as the system captures more data.

That ontology-based software architecture differentiates Palantir from other data analytics platforms. But the company is truly formidable because it has developed an adjacent artificial intelligence platform that lets developers build large language models into workflows and applications, such that users can engage data and automate business processes with natural language.
Dan Ives, senior equity research analyst at Wedbush Securities, selected Palantir as one of his top picks for 2026. He says, "It's the gold standard when it comes to AI use cases. From all of our work, 70% to 80% of every AI use case, Palantir is ultimately involved." But Ives is not the only analyst to praise the company.
Forrester Research ranks Palantir as a leader in AI/ML platforms and AI decisioning platforms. The analysts write, "Palantir has one of the strongest offerings in the AI/ML space with a vision and roadmap to create a platform that brings together humans and machines in a joint decision-making model." The International Data Corporation also ranks Palantir as a leader in decision intelligence software.

Story Continues
Importantly, Palantir's revenue growth has accelerated in nine straight quarters, and those accolades suggest the company is well positioned to maintain that momentum. Spending on AI platforms is projected to increase at 38% annually through 2033, according to Grand View Research.
Palantir is one of the most expensive software stocks in history Palantir is undoubtedly an excellent company, but famous value investor Warren Buffett once warned investors, "A too-high purchase price for the stock of an excellent company can undo the effects of a subsequent decade of favorable business developments."
Palantir currently has a price-to-sales (PS) ratio of 107, which makes it the most expensive stock in the S&P 500 several times over. AppLovin is second at 38 times sales. That means Palantir could lose about two-thirds of its value and still be the most expensive stock in the index. Alternatively, Palantir's revenue could grow at 40% annually for the next three years, and it would still trade at 39 times sales even if its share price remains unchanged.

More concerning, I reviewed the historical valuations of more than 100 software stocks, including every software stock in the S&P 500, and arrived at this conclusion: Only seven software stocks besides Palantir have achieved PS ratios above 100, and all seven fell at least 65% after hitting their peak valuation. The average peak-to-trough decline was 79%.
What does that mean? As things stand, Palantir hit its peak PS ratio of 137 times sales on Aug. 12, when the stock traded at $187 per share. The stock will eventually drop 79% to $39 per share if its performance matches the historical average. Of course, past results are no guarantee of future returns, but I think the risk-reward profile is heavily skewed toward risk.
However, Dan Ives sees the situation differently. He recently wrote, "With the company making strategic moves to remain at the forefront of AI, we believe that PLTR has a golden path to become a trillion-dollar market cap company and will grow into its valuation."

Should you buy stock in Palantir Technologies right now? Before you buy stock in Palantir Technologies, consider this:
The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks for investors to buy nowâ€¦ and Palantir Technologies wasnâ€™t one of them. The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years.

Consider when Netflix made this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, youâ€™d have $493,290 !* Or when Nvidia made this list on April 15, 2005... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, youâ€™d have $1,153,214 !*
Now, itâ€™s worth noting Stock Advisorâ€™s total average return is 973 % â€” a market-crushing outperformance compared to 195% for the S&P 500. Don't miss the latest top 10 list, available with Stock Advisor , and join an investing community built by individual investors for individual investors.
See the 10 stocks Â»
*Stock Advisor returns as of January 7, 2026.
Trevor Jennewine has positions in Nvidia, Palantir Technologies, and Tesla. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Nvidia, Palantir Technologies, and Tesla. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy .

news.Title: Is It Too Late To Consider Alphabet (GOOGL) After Its 62.7% One Year Run?
news.Content:
If you are wondering whether Alphabet's share price still makes sense after its long run, looking at how the market is valuing the business today can help you frame that question more clearly.
Alphabet closed at US$314.34, with returns of 0.4% over the last 7 days, 0.2% over the last 30 days, a 0.3% decline year to date, and 62.7% over the past year, as well as 246.1% over 3 years and 262.5% over 5 years.
Recent headlines around Alphabet have continued to focus on its role in large cap US technology, with investors paying close attention to how it is positioned within key digital advertising and services markets. This context helps explain why the stock's long term returns are front of mind when people look at where it trades today.
On our checklist of 6 valuation tests, Alphabet scores 2 out of 6 for being potentially undervalued, as shown by its valuation score . Next, we will break down what different valuation approaches say about the stock before finishing with a more complete way to think about what the current price might be telling you.

Alphabet scores just 2/6 on our valuation checks. See what other red flags we found in the full valuation breakdown .
Approach 1: Alphabet Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Analysis A Discounted Cash Flow, or DCF, model takes estimates of the cash Alphabet could generate in the future and discounts them back to what that stream might be worth in today's money.
Alphabet's latest twelve month free cash flow is about $92.6b. Using a 2 Stage Free Cash Flow to Equity model, analysts and internal estimates project free cash flow out over the next decade, with Simply Wall St extrapolating beyond the typical 5 year analyst window. For example, projected free cash flow in 2030 is $189.0b, with a discounted value of $126.96b, and the model also applies discounted projections for each year from 2026 through 2035.

Pulling all those discounted cash flows together gives an estimated intrinsic value of $312.02 per share. Set against the recent share price of $314.34, the DCF output suggests Alphabet is about 0.7% overvalued, which is a very small gap and effectively within a margin of error for this kind of model.
Result: ABOUT RIGHT
Alphabet is fairly valued according to our Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) , but this can change at a moment's notice. Track the value in your watchlist or portfolio and be alerted on when to act.
Head to the Valuation section of our Company Report for more details on how we arrive at this Fair Value for Alphabet.
Approach 2: Alphabet Price vs Earnings For profitable companies like Alphabet, the P/E ratio is a useful shorthand because it links what you pay per share to the earnings that support that price. Investors usually expect higher growth or lower risk to justify a higher P/E, while slower growth or higher risk tends to align with a lower, more conservative P/E.

Story Continues
Alphabet currently trades on a P/E of 30.53x. That is higher than the Interactive Media and Services industry average P/E of 15.44x, but below the peer group average of 54.30x. Simply Wall St also calculates a Fair Ratio of 39.67x, which is the P/E that might be expected given Alphabet's earnings growth profile, industry, profit margins, market cap and risk factors.

This Fair Ratio is more tailored than a simple industry or peer comparison, because those benchmarks do not adjust for company specific features such as profitability, size or risk. Set against the current P/E of 30.53x, the Fair Ratio of 39.67x suggests Alphabet's shares are trading below the level implied by these fundamentals.
Result: UNDERVALUED
P/E ratios tell one story, but what if the real opportunity lies elsewhere? Discover 1447 companies where insiders are betting big on explosive growth .
Upgrade Your Decision Making: Choose your Alphabet Narrative Earlier we mentioned that there is an even better way to understand valuation, so let us introduce you to Narratives, which let you attach a clear story to your numbers by linking your view of Alphabet's business to a financial forecast and then to a fair value estimate.
On Simply Wall St's Community page, Narratives are an easy tool that millions of investors use to spell out their assumptions about future revenue, earnings and margins. This means you are not just looking at a single fair value figure, you are seeing the reasoning that sits behind it.

Each Narrative connects that forecast to a fair value and then compares it to the current share price. This can help you consider whether the gap between Fair Value and Price looks large enough to justify buying, holding or selling based on your own comfort level.
Because Narratives are updated when new information such as Alphabet's earnings, AI product announcements or regulatory news is added, the story and the valuation move together rather than leaving you with a stale model.
For Alphabet today, one investor on the Community page currently values the stock at about US$171.36 per share, while another values it at about US$340.00. This shows how different, but clearly explained, Narratives can coexist around the same company and give you a spectrum of views to weigh against your own.

For Alphabet however we will make it really easy for you with previews of two leading Alphabet Narratives:
These give you a clear bull and bear framework around the same set of facts, so you can see how different investors connect the dots on cash flows, AI, and long term earnings power.
ğŸ‚ Alphabet Bull Case
Fair value in this narrative: US$340.00 per share
Gap between narrative value and recent price: Alphabet trades at about 7.6% below this fair value estimate based on the last close of US$314.34
Revenue growth assumption used: 17.36%
Alphabet is framed as a cash generating platform across Search, YouTube, Ads and Cloud, with a very strong balance sheet and substantial free cash flow supporting ongoing buybacks.
AI, Cloud and YouTube monetisation are treated as long term earnings engines, with Googleâ€™s historic AI research and Berkshire Hathawayâ€™s interest used as support for a higher future P/E multiple.
Regulation, AI competition and ad cycles are acknowledged as risks, but the author argues Alphabetâ€™s breadth of products and financial strength give it room to absorb setbacks.

ğŸ» Alphabet Bear Case
Fair value in this narrative: US$212.34 per share
Gap between narrative value and recent price: Alphabet trades at about 48.0% above this fair value estimate based on the last close of US$314.34
Revenue growth assumption used: 13.47%
This narrative still expects ongoing Search, Ads and Cloud revenue, but sees the current share price as rich compared to steady growth and the cost of scaling generative AI services.
Generative AI is viewed as sustaining rather than disruptive, yet potentially expensive to run, so the author builds in higher profit margins over time but keeps a more cautious valuation multiple.
Key watchpoints include ad market conditions, AI monetisation, regulation and competition from products like ChatGPT and Bing, which could affect how much earnings support the current price.

Together, these Narratives show how two informed investors can look at the same company, use different assumptions on revenue growth, margins and P/E, and end up with very different fair values. The useful part for you is not just the end numbers but the specific levers they focus on, which you can compare to your own view of Alphabetâ€™s business.
Curious how numbers become stories that shape markets? Explore Community Narratives
Do you think there's more to the story for Alphabet? Head over to our Community to see what others are saying!

It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. news.Title: Is STMicroelectronics (ENXTPA:STMPA) Fairly Priced After Recent Share Price Rebound
news.Content:
STMEF

If you are wondering whether STMicroelectronics is attractively priced right now, you are not alone. The stock sits at the center of a bigger question about what investors are actually paying for.
The share price is up 11.4% over the last 7 days and 11.6% over the last 30 days, even though the 1 year return is a 1.8% decline and the 3 year and 5 year returns are 30.6% and 22.5% declines respectively.
These mixed returns put extra focus on recent headlines around STMicroelectronics and how investors are reassessing chip makers more broadly. That context helps explain why some shareholders may see fresh potential while others remain cautious about the risks.
Right now, STMicroelectronics has a valuation score of 2 out of 6. This means it screens as undervalued on 2 of our 6 checks and sets up a closer look at different valuation methods next, before finishing with a more complete way to think about what the stock might be worth.

STMicroelectronics scores just 2/6 on our valuation checks. See what other red flags we found in the full valuation breakdown .
Approach 1: STMicroelectronics Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Analysis A Discounted Cash Flow, or DCF, model estimates what a company might be worth by projecting its future cash flows and then discounting those back to today to reflect risk and the time value of money.
For STMicroelectronics, the 2 Stage Free Cash Flow to Equity model starts from last twelve month free cash flow of US$647.9 million loss and then uses analyst estimates for the next few years, with further years extrapolated by Simply Wall St. The ten year projections show free cash flow reaching about US$2.4b by 2035, with interim estimates such as US$893 million in 2026 and US$1.8b in 2028. All of these future cash flows are converted into todayâ€™s dollars using a discount rate.

Adding those discounted cash flows together gives an estimated intrinsic value of â‚¬25.79 per share. Compared with the current market price, the model implies the stock is about 3.0% undervalued, so it is effectively in line with what the DCF suggests it might be worth.
Result: ABOUT RIGHT
STMicroelectronics is fairly valued according to our Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) , but this can change at a moment's notice. Track the value in your watchlist or portfolio and be alerted on when to act.
Head to the Valuation section of our Company Report for more details on how we arrive at this Fair Value for STMicroelectronics.
Approach 2: STMicroelectronics Price vs Earnings For profitable companies, the P/E ratio is a useful shorthand because it links what you pay for each share directly to the earnings that support that share. It lets you quickly see how much the market is willing to pay for each unit of profit, which is often how investors think about established businesses.

Story Continues
What counts as a normal or fair P/E depends on what investors expect for future growth and how risky they think those earnings are. Higher expected growth or lower perceived risk can justify a higher P/E, while slower growth or higher uncertainty typically points to a lower multiple.
STMicroelectronics is currently trading on a P/E of 48.39x. That is above the Semiconductor industry average of 39.02x, but below the peer group average of 64.53x. Simply Wall St also calculates a Fair Ratio of 48.13x, which reflects factors such as the companyâ€™s earnings growth profile, profit margins, industry, market cap and risk characteristics. This Fair Ratio is more tailored than a simple industry or peer comparison because it aims to line up the multiple with STMicroelectronics own fundamentals. With the actual P/E very close to the Fair Ratio, the shares look broadly in line with what this model suggests.
Result: ABOUT RIGHT
P/E ratios tell one story, but what if the real opportunity lies elsewhere? Discover 1447 companies where insiders are betting big on explosive growth .
Upgrade Your Decision Making: Choose your STMicroelectronics Narrative Earlier we mentioned that there is an even better way to understand valuation. On Simply Wall Stâ€™s Community page you can use Narratives, which let you attach your own story about STMicroelectronics to hard numbers by setting assumptions for future revenue, earnings and margins. You can then link that forecast to a fair value that you can compare with todayâ€™s price to decide if it looks expensive or cheap. Each Narrative updates automatically as new news or earnings arrive. One investor might build a bullish STMicroelectronics view closer to the higher analyst price target of â‚¬31.05, while another might lean toward the more cautious â‚¬20.09 end. You can see both perspectives side by side rather than relying on a single static model.
Do you think there's more to the story for STMicroelectronics? Head over to our Community to see what others are saying!

news.Title: What Catalysts Are Quietly Rewriting The Microsoft (MSFT) AI And Cloud Narrative
news.Content:
Microsoftâ€™s latest valuation tweak reflects a market still trying to balance big AI and cloud ambitions with fresh questions around capital intensity and earnings risk. The fair value estimate has edged down slightly to US$622.51, with a marginal adjustment to the discount rate and revenue growth assumptions that keeps the long term story intact but a bit more measured. Stay tuned to see how you can track these kinds of small but important shifts in the Microsoft narrative as new research and data come through.

Analyst Price Targets don't always capture the full story. Head over to our Company Report to find new ways to value Microsoft.
What Wall Street Has Been Saying ğŸ‚ Bullish Takeaways
Several firms highlight Microsoft as well positioned around artificial intelligence and cloud, with Baird saying the company is "leading the AI revolution" across infrastructure and applications and Morgan Stanley emphasizing what it calls a "leadership position" in the GenAI race given deep product integrations and AI infrastructure investment.
Analysts at Morgan Stanley, Bernstein and RBC point to recent Q1 results as supportive of the current equity story, citing beats versus consensus across major segments, strong commercial bookings and what they describe as solid cloud momentum tied to Azure and AI driven customer commitments.
Goldman Sachs, Evercore ISI, Morgan Stanley and Truist all frame the updated OpenAI agreement and the US$250b Azure services commitment as positive for Microsoft's role in AI workloads, with Evercore ISI and Truist also flagging an estimated 27% OpenAI stake value and long dated IP rights as supporting assets.
Morgan Stanley and Guggenheim underline breadth beyond a single AI partner, with Morgan Stanley arguing the Microsoft story extends beyond generative AI alone and Guggenheim pointing to the Office productivity suite and Windows as key cash generating pillars that can support monetization of AI offerings.
Target moves from firms such as Morgan Stanley (to US$650 from US$625), Bernstein (to US$645 from US$637) and RBC (US$640) indicate that a number of bullish and neutral leaning analysts see room within their models for higher fair value estimates even after a period of strong share price performance, while still flagging issues such as AI capex and cycle concerns.

ğŸ» Bearish Takeaways
Rothschild & Co Redburn shifted to a Neutral stance and cut its Microsoft target to US$500 from US$560, arguing that it is "time to take a more cautious stance on the hyperscalers" and that the economics of newer GPU heavy deployments look weaker than what it calls cloud 1.0, with capital needs roughly six times higher to generate similar value.
The same firm contends that investors may be giving large cloud platforms too much benefit of the doubt by treating current heavy AI spending as if it carried earlier phase return profiles, and ties its downgrade to lower earnings expectations and higher capex requirements to sustain growth.
Even bullish firms like Baird and others reference elements such as AI related capex and broader cycle questions as overhangs or sources of recent share price volatility, noting that some of the upside case is already reflected in the valuation and that execution on large AI and cloud commitments will be closely watched.

Story Continues
Do your thoughts align with the Bull or Bear Analysts? Perhaps you think there's more to the story. Head to the Simply Wall St Community to discover more perspectives or begin writing your own Narrative!
What's in the News Microsoft is ramping up global AI and cloud infrastructure, with a planned US$17.5b investment in India over four years and more than C$7.5b, about US$5.4b, in Canada, including new sovereign cloud options and a cybersecurity Threat Intelligence Hub aimed at local customers.
The company is deepening its role in the AI model ecosystem through an expanded partnership with Anthropic that includes plans for up to US$5b from Microsoft and up to US$10b from NVIDIA, alongside a long term Azure compute commitment and broad access to Anthropicâ€™s Claude models.
Cloud and AI capacity buildout remains a central focus. Microsoft is highlighting an 80% planned increase in total AI capacity this year, expectations to roughly double its data center footprint over two years, and new facilities such as the Fairwater AI â€œsuper factoryâ€ in Atlanta for large scale training workloads.
Regulatory and governance scrutiny is rising, as the EU reviews whether Azure should face additional Digital Markets Act restrictions after several cloud outages, while multiple investor groups have filed proposals on human rights due diligence and board nominations ahead of Microsoftâ€™s 2025 annual meeting.

How This Changes the Fair Value For Microsoft Fair value edged down slightly from US$624.45 to US$622.51, a change of about US$1.93.
The discount rate is shown at 8.53% in both the prior and updated model, with a very small adjustment reflected in the required return assumptions.
Revenue growth is trimmed slightly in the updated assumptions, from 15.30% to 15.28%.
The forecast net profit margin is nudged slightly higher, moving from 37.93% to 37.97%.
The future P/E used in the model eases modestly from 34.71x to 34.58x, indicating a small reduction in the valuation multiple applied.

ğŸ”” Never Miss an Update: Follow The Narrative Narratives on Simply Wall St let you connect the story you believe about a company with the numbers behind it, tying your view on Microsoftâ€™s business, future revenue, earnings and margins to a forecast and then to a fair value. Hosted on the Community page used by millions of investors, Narratives update as new news or earnings land, so you can compare Fair Value to the current share price and decide how that lines up with your own buy or sell timing.

Head over to the Simply Wall St Community and follow the Narrative on Microsoft to stay on top of how this story is evolving in real time:
How expanding AI infrastructure, Azure growth and the OpenAI and Anthropic partnerships feed into revenue, margin and fair value assumptions in the current Microsoft Narrative .
What the consensus expects for revenue, earnings and margins out to 2028 and which fair value and P/E assumptions you would need to agree with to share that view.
Which risks around heavy AI and cloud capex, customer concentration and cloud outages could challenge the story and lead to a different Fair Value than the US$622.51 estimate today.

news.Title: Is It Too Late To Consider Taiwan Semiconductor (NYSE:TSM) After Its Strong Multiâ€‘Year Rally?
news.Content:
TSMWF

If you are wondering whether Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing is still reasonably priced after its strong run, this article walks through what the current share price might be implying about value.
The stock recently closed at US$327.43, with returns of 9.3% over the last 7 days, 11.1% over the last 30 days, 2.4% year to date, 56.5% over 1 year and a very large gain over 3 years that is well above 7x, along with 184.2% over 5 years.
Recent headlines around Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing have centered on its role as a key global chip manufacturer and its position in semiconductor supply chains. This often draws attention whenever sentiment around chip demand shifts and helps explain why investors regularly reassess what they are willing to pay for the stock.
Right now, our valuation framework gives the company a 3 out of 6 score for being undervalued. Next we will look at how different valuation methods line up with that result, before closing with a way to think about value that goes beyond the usual multiples and models.

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing delivered 56.5% returns over the last year. See how this stacks up to the rest of the Semiconductor industry.
Approach 1: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Analysis The Discounted Cash Flow, or DCF, model estimates what a business might be worth today by projecting its future cash flows and then discounting those back to a present value.
For Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, the model used is a 2 Stage Free Cash Flow to Equity approach based on cash flow projections. The latest twelve month free cash flow is NT$802,353.56m, or about NT$802.4b. Analyst sourced and extrapolated projections from Simply Wall St suggest free cash flow reaching NT$3,272,811.55m, around NT$3.27t, by 2035.

Discounting these projected cash flows results in an estimated intrinsic value of US$206.81 per share, compared with the recent share price of US$327.43. On this basis, the DCF output suggests the stock is 58.3% above that fair value estimate.
This model indicates a strong business that, at the current price, appears to be priced well above what its projected cash generation alone might support.
Result: OVERVALUED
Our Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing may be overvalued by 58.3%. Discover 876 undervalued stocks or create your own screener to find better value opportunities.
Head to the Valuation section of our Company Report for more details on how we arrive at this Fair Value for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing.

Story Continues
Approach 2: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Price vs Earnings For a profitable business like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, the P/E ratio is a useful way to see what investors are currently willing to pay for each dollar of earnings. It connects directly to profitability, which is often easier to compare across companies than cash flow models or asset values.

Growth expectations and risk both influence what looks like a â€œnormalâ€ P/E. Higher expected earnings growth or lower perceived risk can support a higher P/E, while slower growth or greater risk usually justify a lower one. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing currently trades on a P/E of 28.13x. That sits below the Semiconductor industry average of 41.19x and the peer group average of 65.05x, based on the data provided.
Simply Wall Stâ€™s Fair Ratio is a proprietary estimate of what a more tailored P/E might be, given factors such as earnings growth, margins, industry, market cap and risk profile. This tends to be more informative than a simple comparison with industry or peer averages, because those benchmarks do not adjust for a companyâ€™s specific characteristics. For Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, the Fair Ratio is 38.20x, which is above the current 28.13x P/E, suggesting the shares may be trading below that tailored benchmark.
Result: UNDERVALUED
P/E ratios tell one story, but what if the real opportunity lies elsewhere? Discover 1447 companies where insiders are betting big on explosive growth .
Upgrade Your Decision Making: Choose your Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Narrative Earlier we mentioned that there is an even better way to understand valuation, so let us introduce you to Narratives. Narratives let you attach a clear story about Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing to the numbers you care about by linking your view of its future revenue, earnings and margins to a forecast, a fair value, and a simple buy or sell framework. This framework lives inside Simply Wall Stâ€™s Community page, updates automatically when fresh news or earnings are released, and can differ widely between investors. For example, one user Narrative on NYSE:TSM estimates fair value at about US$310 per share, while another might set a much lower or higher figure based on the same facts but a different interpretation of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturingâ€™s role in AI, its margin profile and its risks.
Do you think there's more to the story for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing? Head over to our Community to see what others are saying!

news.Title: AnalystView Market Insights: Healthcare Virtual Assistant Market to Grow at a 35.08% CAGR Through 2032, Reaching US$ 29.63 Billion, Led by Nuance Communications, Microsoft, and Amazon.com
news.Content:
AMZN

Market growth is supported by advancements in AI-powered product offerings, cloud-based deployment models, and expanding clinical functionalities, with increasing adoption across hospitals, clinics, and home care settings. According to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), administrative tasks account for nearly 25â€“30% of total healthcare operational costs, accelerating demand for virtual assistants to improve efficiency and patient engagement.

San Francisco, USA, Jan. 07, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The global Healthcare Virtual Assistant Market is entering a phase of rapid acceleration, fueled by advancements in conversational AI, mounting pressure on healthcare systems, and the growing need for intelligent, automated patient-support solutions. Valued at US$ 1,806.74 million in 2024, the market is projected to expand at a CAGR of 35.08% between 2025 and 2032, reaching US$ 29,630.51 million by 2032. Hospitals, insurers, pharmaceutical companies, and digital health platforms are increasingly deploying virtual assistants to enhance operational efficiency, reduce administrative burden, and improve patient outcomes. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), global healthcare systems face a projected shortfall of 10 million healthcare workers by 2030, reinforcing the urgency for AI-driven digital support tools.

Over the next decade, healthcare-specific AI assistants are expected to become integral to clinical workflows, patient communication, appointment scheduling, medication adherence, and chronic-disease management, driving a fundamental shift toward more automated, scalable, and resilient healthcare delivery models worldwide.
This in-depth, newsroom-style report examines the factors fueling demand, key technological innovations, evolving patient expectations, the growing role of automation across clinical and administrative functions, and the competitive landscape shaping the marketâ€™s next phase of evolution.
Download a complimentary sample now.@ https://www.analystviewmarketinsights.com/request_sample/AV4644
A New Era of Intelligent Care Delivery

Healthcare systems globally are under immense strain due to a convergence of structural challenges, including rapidly aging populations, a rising prevalence of chronic diseases, persistent healthcare workforce shortages, escalating operational and administrative costs, and growing patient expectations for timely, personalized, and digitally enabled care. These pressures are stretching hospitals, clinics, and care providers beyond traditional capacity limits, particularly in front-office operations, patient engagement, and routine clinical support functions.

Story Continues
As a result, healthcare providers are increasingly turning to artificial intelligenceâ€“powered virtual assistants to automate tasks that previously required extensive administrative or clinical manpower. AI-driven assistants are now supporting appointment scheduling, symptom triage, medication reminders, patient education, and follow-up communication at scale. By reducing manual workloads, improving response times, and enabling 24/7 patient interaction, virtual assistants are emerging as a critical tool to enhance operational efficiency, support overstretched healthcare staff, and maintain quality of care in an increasingly complex global health environment.

Virtual assistants in healthcare now handle an expanding list of responsibilities:
Appointment scheduling and reminders

Symptom triage using natural language interactions

Pre-consultation data collection

Medication reminders

Billing inquiries and insurance support

Mental-health check-ins and wellness monitoring

Chronic-disease coaching

Real-time patient feedback

As these systems become more advancedâ€”utilizing conversational models similar to GPT, multimodal AI, and predictive analyticsâ€”their accuracy and reliability have improved dramatically. This shift has boosted provider confidence and broadened applications beyond simple chatbots to fully integrated digital care companions.
Market Momentum Driven by Expanding Use Cases
The adoption of healthcare virtual assistants is no longer limited to consumer health apps. Providers, insurers, pharmacies, and even medical device manufacturers are building or deploying assistants tailored to their workflows.

1. Hospitals and Clinics: Reducing Administrative Burdens
Hospitals are deploying virtual assistants to manage routine tasks that consume staff time. With burnout at historic levels, these tools are helping:
Reduce call-center traffic

Answer patient queries instantly

Support clinical documentation

Provide pre- and post-care instructions

Streamline patient onboarding

By automating repetitive tasks, hospitals can redirect human resources toward higher-priority clinical care.
2. Telehealth Platforms: Enhancing Remote Patient Care
Telemedicine organizations use virtual assistants as triage tools and communication layers between patients and doctors. They help collect patient symptoms before appointments, recommend care pathways, and escalate urgent cases instantly.

Virtual assistants also improve adherence in virtual chronic-care programs by sending reminders, collecting vitals, and offering lifestyle guidanceâ€”building continuity in remote care.
3. Health Insurance and Payors: Speeding Customer Support
Insurers are using AI assistants to:
Explain insurance coverage

Process billing inquiries

Assist in claims management

Provide 24/7 customer support

These systems reduce operational costs while improving engagement and transparency for members.
4. Pharma and Life Sciences: Supporting Patient Education
Pharmaceutical companies are integrating AI assistants to improve patient understanding of medications, manage side-effect reporting, and support patient-support programs in chronic disease segments.
Technology Evolution Paves the Way for Next-Generation Assistants

The capabilities of healthcare virtual assistants have improved dramatically over the last five years, primarily due to advancements in:
1.Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Virtual assistants now understand medical terminology, patient descriptions, and complex queries with far greater accuracy. Context-aware interaction makes assistants feel conversational rather than scripted.
2. Multimodal AI
Some advanced systems now interpret images, voice notes, and text, enabling richer interactions such as analyzing a picture of a rash or understanding a patientâ€™s spoken symptoms.
3. Integration with Electronic Health Records (EHR)
Seamless EHR integration is a breakthrough that allows virtual assistants to:
Retrieve patient history

Update medical records

Assist clinicians by pulling diagnostic details

Generate documentation

This reduces manual data entryâ€”a major source of physician fatigue.
4. Voice-Enabled Systems
Smart speakers and voice-activated assistants are rapidly entering clinical settings, enabling hands-free interactions for both patients and healthcare staff.
5. Machine Learning for Predictive Health Insights
AI systems are learning from large datasets to predict health trends, recommend interventions, and support early disease detection. The fusion of these technologies is transforming virtual assistants from simple Q&A bots into intelligent digital health companions capable of delivering meaningful insights.
Key Market Drivers Accelerating Growth
1. Rising Demand for 24/7 Healthcare Support
As healthcare delivery becomes increasingly patient-centric and digital-first, expectations for round-the-clock access to medical information and services are rising sharply. Patients now seek immediate responses for appointment queries, symptom guidance, medication instructions, and follow-up careâ€”regardless of time or location. Meeting these expectations through traditional staffing models is costly and operationally challenging for healthcare providers.

AI-powered healthcare virtual assistants address this gap by delivering real-time, consistent, and accurate support 24/7 without the need for continuous human intervention. These systems can handle high volumes of routine patient interactions simultaneously, reduce wait times, and ensure uninterrupted engagement outside standard clinical hours. By enabling continuous access to care-related information while easing staff workloads, virtual assistants are becoming a vital component of modern healthcare service models, supporting both operational efficiency and improved patient satisfaction.
2. Chronic Disease Epidemic
Patients managing diabetes, hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and respiratory disorder rely on continuous monitoring. Virtual assistants provide daily guidance and data tracking.

3. Growing Shortage of Healthcare Professionals
As healthcare labor shortages intensify, providers increasingly view automation as a necessity rather than an option.
4. Cost-Reduction Pressures
AI assistants significantly reduce the cost of patient support operations, administrative processes, and triage workflows.
5. Telemedicine Expansion
With telehealth becoming a standard offering, virtual assistants act as the front door to digital care.
Challenges the Market Must Overcome
Despite promising growth, several barriers still limit adoption:
1. Data Privacy and Security
Healthcare is one of the most regulated sectors. Ensuring compliance with HIPAA and global privacy laws is a major challenge.
2. Bias and Accuracy Concerns
AI systems trained on limited datasets risk misinterpretation or inaccurate recommendations, especially in clinical triage.

3. Integration Complexity
Connecting AI assistants to legacy EHR and hospital systems often requires significant customization.
Regional Outlook: Global Surge in Adoption
North America
North America holds the largest share of the healthcare virtual assistant market, supported by early adoption of artificial intelligence, advanced clinical and digital health infrastructure, and a well-established telehealth ecosystem. The United States leads regional growth, driven by strong investments from hospitals, technology providers, and health insurers. According to the U.S. Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), national health expenditure in the U.S. exceeded US$ 4.8 trillion in 2023, highlighting the scale of the healthcare system and the growing focus on digital tools, including AI-enabled virtual assistants, to improve efficiency, patient engagement, and care delivery outcomes.

Europe
Europe is experiencing accelerated growth as governments actively advance digital health transformation across healthcare systems. Strict GDPR regulations have compelled providers to implement robust data security and privacy frameworks, increasing confidence in AI-powered virtual assistants. These regulatory safeguards make virtual assistants more trustworthy, supporting wider adoption across hospitals, clinics, and patient-facing digital platforms.
Asia-Pacific
Asia-Pacific is emerging as a high-growth region, driven by:
Large population base
Expanding digital health programs
Increasing smartphone adoption
Government initiatives supporting AI in healthcare
Countries such as India, China, and South Korea are emerging as major hubs for AI-driven healthcare innovation due to strong government backing, large patient populations, and rapid digitalization of health systems. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), Asia-Pacific accounts for over 60% of the global population, creating massive demand for scalable digital health solutions. Additionally, the OECD reports that countries like South Korea and China rank among the fastest adopters of AI in healthcare, supported by national AI strategies, expanding telehealth infrastructure, and rising public and private investment in health technology innovation.

Competitive Landscape: Tech Giants and Health AI Innovators Lead the Race
The Healthcare Virtual Assistant Market features a blend of global technology companies, AI startups, medical software providers, and telehealth innovators. Companies are focusing on developing assistants that are:
More conversational
Context-aware
Emotionally intelligent
Highly integrated with clinical systems
Key areas of competition include:
Speech recognition accuracy

Industry-specific compliance

Multilingual support

Personalization capabilities

Integration into hospital command centers
Strategic partnerships between large tech firms and healthcare providers are becoming common as AI workloads increase.
Looking Ahead: The Future of Healthcare Virtual Assistants
The next phase of innovation will push virtual assistants into deeper clinical and emotional-support roles. Future assistants may:

Perform AI-driven triage with medical-grade accuracy

Detect early signs of mental-health deterioration

Interpret patient emotions using sentiment analysis

Assist clinicians in real-time decision making

Enable hyper-personalized care programs

Act as continuous companions for elderly populations

Integrate with wearable devices to monitor vitals and predict medical events

As AI becomes more advanced and regulation becomes clearer, healthcare virtual assistants will transition from being supportive tools to becoming essential components of patient-centric care models.

news.Title: US hotels react as Trump releases 35,000 new H-2B visas
news.Content:
US hotels react as Trump releases 35,000 new H-2B visas

Mohamed Dabo
Wed, January 7, 2026 at 1:47 AM PST 3 min read

The US hotel sector has responded to the Trump Administrationâ€™s announcement of 35,000 supplemental Hâ€‘2B visas for fiscal year 2026, recognising the move as a shortâ€‘term boost for seasonal hiring while emphasising broader workforce concerns.
The additional visas, issued by the Departments of Homeland Security and Labor, aim to help hospitality employers fill temporary positions ahead of peak travel seasons.

For readers unfamiliar with U.S. immigration programs, Hâ€‘2B visas are temporary work visas that allow U.S. employers to hire foreign nationals for non-agricultural seasonal jobs, such as housekeeping, front desk roles, or maintenance in hotels and resorts.
They are typically used to meet labour demand during busy periods when domestic workers are unavailable.
Industry sees temporary relief for staffing gaps Hotel operators and industry groups have welcomed the supplemental Hâ€‘2B visa release as a needed relief for staffing shortages that have affected front-line roles in housekeeping, guest services, and maintenance.
Many hotels, particularly in high-tourism regions or more remote locations, have struggled to recruit domestic workers in numbers sufficient to meet demand, leading to operational pressures during peak periods.

The additional 35,000 visas supplement the statutory cap of 66,000 Hâ€‘2B visas that U.S. employers can access each year.
The American Hotel & Lodging Association (AHLA) said the visas will make it easier for small and independent hoteliers to access the seasonal workers they need.
AHLAâ€™s president and CEO noted that while the decision helps address immediate staffing challenges, the industry continues to call for reforms to create a more stable and predictable visa framework.
Calls for broader workforce strategy persist Industry reactions have highlighted that the supplemental visas, while beneficial, do not fully resolve long-standing labour issues in the hospitality sector.
AHLA and other stakeholders have reiterated their position that the current visa cap system is outdated and misaligned with actual labour demand, urging Congress and the Administration to consider long-term changes.

Such reforms would aim to tie visa availability more closely to real-time workforce needs rather than fixed numerical limits.
Hotel employers and industry analysts also point to the need for complementary domestic workforce strategies. These include retention efforts and career development programmes intended to reduce reliance on temporary visa holders over time, helping ensure hotels can balance seasonal fluctuations with stable staffing.

Story Continues
Preparing for implementation and operational planning With the temporary final rule outlining eligibility and application criteria expected to be published soon, hotel operators are already preparing to adjust recruitment plans.
The Office of Foreign Labor Certification continues to manage the Hâ€‘2B application process, including assignment of applications for work start dates in 2026.

For the current season, the visa release has been broadly interpreted within the hospitality industry as a pragmatic step toward alleviating seasonal labour shortfalls, even as sector leaders stress the importance of broader workforce reform to support sustainable growth and service quality in US hotels.
"US hotels react as Trump releases 35,000 new H-2B visas" was originally created and published by Hotel Management Network , a GlobalData owned brand.

news.Title: Assessing Cisco Systems (CSCO) Valuation After Recent Short Term Share Price Softness
news.Content:
Cisco Systems (CSCO) has been drawing attention after a period in which the share price has shown mixed short-term movements, including a decline over the past day and past week, alongside a gain over the past three months.
See our latest analysis for Cisco Systems.
Stepping back, Cisco Systemsâ€™ recent share price softness, including a 1-day share price return decline of 0.46% and a 7-day share price return decline of 2.82%, sits alongside a 1-year total shareholder return of 30.76%. This points to longer term momentum still outpacing the short term pullback as investors reassess growth potential and risk.

If Ciscoâ€™s recent moves have your attention, it could be a moment to see how it compares with other high growth tech and AI names in high growth tech and AI stocks .
With Cisco trading at US$75.23, alongside an indicated intrinsic discount of about 8% and a roughly 14% gap to the average analyst target, you have to ask: is there still upside here, or is future growth already priced in?
Most Popular Narrative: 11.7% Undervalued With Cisco Systems last closing at US$75.23 versus a most-followed fair value estimate around US$85, the narrative frames the shares as trading at a discount while hinging heavily on an AI and networking build out story.
Read the complete narrative.
Curious what earnings profile could back up that kind of fair value gap? The narrative leans on steadier growth, fatter margins, and a richer future earnings multiple. Want to see how those moving parts fit together?
Result: Fair Value of $85.24 (UNDERVALUED)
Have a read of the narrative in full and understand what's behind the forecasts.

However, this depends on AI networking orders and the shift to subscriptions continuing smoothly, while competition, security softness, and large acquisition integration do not erode margins.

news.Title: Asia-Pacific B2C Ecommerce Market Report 2025-2029: Alibaba, JD.com, Amazon, Flipkart, Shopee, Lazada, Rakuten, and Coupang Face Rising Competition From Temu, Shein, and TikTokâ€“Tokopedia
news.Content:
JD

AMZN

RKUNF

CPNG

Significant opportunities in Asia-Pacific's ecommerce market emerge from the rise of digital payments reshaping transactions in India and Southeast Asia. Integration with social-media platforms enhances ecommerce in China and Indonesia. Cross-border platforms disrupt Australia and Japan. Quick-commerce grows in India, Korea, and Japan.
Asia-Pacific B2C Ecommerce Market
Dublin, Jan. 07, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "Asia-Pacific B2C Ecommerce Market Size & Forecast by Value and Volume Across 80+ KPIs - Databook Q4 2025 Update" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.

The ecommerce market in Asia-Pacific was expected to grow by 7% annually, reaching US$3.83 trillion by 2025.

The ecommerce market in the region has experienced robust growth during 2020-2024, achieving a CAGR of 9.7%. This upward trajectory is expected to continue, with the market forecast to grow at a CAGR of 5.9% from 2025 to 2029. By the end of 2029, the ecommerce market is projected to expand from its 2024 value of US$3.58 trillion to approximately US$4.83 trillion.
This report provides a detailed data-centric analysis of the ecommerce industry in Asia-Pacific offering comprehensive coverage of both overall and ecommerce markets. It includes more than 80+ KPIs, covering gross merchandise value, gross merchandise volume, and average value per transaction.
Competitive Landscape

Competitive intensity is expected to increase as short-video platforms deepen their commerce integration in China and Southeast Asia. At the same time, cross-border entrants continue to reshape price expectations in Australia and Japan. India will see stronger competition in grocery and FMCG as quick-commerce expands into more categories. Regulatory intervention, particularly in Indonesia, Australia, and Japan, will influence platform strategies around pricing, merchant treatment and data practices. The localisation of fulfilment, payments integration, and stronger compliance requirements will determine which firms retain a long-term advantage.

Current State of the Market

Ecommerce in-Pacific is characterised by high competitive intensity, with multinational platforms, domestic marketplaces, social-commerce players and quick-commerce operators all expanding their presence. In China, Alibaba and JD.com continue to face pressure on their market share from platforms built on short-video ecosystems such as Douyin and Kuaishou.
In India, Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart compete closely with Reliance Retail's Ajio and JioMart, while quick-commerce platforms intensify rivalry in daily-needs categories. Southeast Asia remains a multi-player environment where Shopee, Lazada, and Tokopedia (now integrated with TikTok Shop) contest leadership, especially in Indonesia and Vietnam. Developed markets such as Australia, Japan and South Korea face increased pressure from cross-border entrants, most notably Temu and Shein, which are challenging domestic retailers on pricing and fulfilment expectations.

Story Continues
Key Players and New Entrants
Across the region, leading players include Alibaba, JD.com, and Pinduoduo (Temu) in China; Amazon, Flipkart, and Reliance in India; Shopee, Lazada, Tokopedia, and now TikTok-Tokopedia in Southeast Asia; Rakuten and Yahoo! Shopping in Japan; and Coupang in South Korea. New entrants are primarily cross-border Chinese platforms, especially Temu and Shein in Australia and Japan, where consumer adoption has grown sharply. In Indonesia, TikTok formally re-entered ecommerce through its partnership with Tokopedia under new regulatory conditions. In India, domestic platforms continue to emerge in specialised verticals such as beauty, personal care, and pharmacy, though recent entrants remain relatively small compared with the major incumbents.

Recent Launches, Mergers, and Acquisitions
TikTok's integration of TikTok Shop with Tokopedia in Indonesia (2024-25) is the most significant regional restructuring, enabling it to resume ecommerce operations after regulatory restrictions. In Australia, regulatory filings and parliamentary discussions have highlighted rising activity by Temu and Shein, prompting closer scrutiny of consumer protection. In India, quick-commerce firms such as Swiggy Instamart and BigBasket have expanded dark-store networks. At the same time, Reliance continues to acquire and partner with offline retail brands to strengthen omnichannel capabilities. South Korea's Coupang expanded operations into Taiwan, representing cross-market expansion rather than consolidation.

news.Title: Lenovo unveils Nvidia AI partnership, Qira platform
news.Content:
Lenovo unveils Nvidia AI partnership, Qira platform

Reuters Videos
Wed, January 7, 2026 at 12:00 AM PST

In this video: LNVGF

NVDA

STORY: :: Las Vegas, Nevada :: January 6, 2026 :: Lenovo teams with Nvidia to speed up data center setup for AI cloud providers :: Yang Yuanqing, Lenovo CEO "We are launching the Lenovo AI Cloud Gigafactory with Nvidia. It works with, thank you, it works with a new Rubin platform you just announced yesterday." :: The world's top PC maker also debuted Qira, a cross-device AI superagent for Lenovo and Motorola users "Lenovo Qira works on your phone, PC, tablet or wearable, wherever you need AI to be. It works across platforms, from Windows to Android." "Lenovo Qira is truly a perceptive AI. It's keenly aware of its surroundings. It interacts with you however you want to. What do you like or dislike? Lenovo Qira remembers. What do you might need next, it anticipates." The world's largest personal computer maker, which also makes servers, made the announcement at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas while also showcasing an AI platform, concept devices and the first foldable smartphone under its Motorola brand. Under the data center program, Lenovo said it will offer its liquid-cooled hybrid AI infrastructure alongside Nvidia's computing platforms to help AI cloud providers reduce deployment time to "weeks."

news.Title: Telia Lietuva to reorganise Technology unit in digital shift
news.Content:
TLSNF

Telia Lietuva, AB (hereinafter â€œTelia Lietuvaâ€ or â€œthe Companyâ€) is starting a reorganisation of its Digital & Technology unit as part of a broader digital shift across the Telia Company Group. By deploying digital and artificial intelligence (AI) solutions, the Company plans to reduce its workforce by 59 positions. Telia currently employs around 2,500 people in Lithuania.

â€œOver the past five years, we have consistently digitalised our processes and integrated AI solutions. This has enabled more efficient ways of working and has led us to review the structure of the combined Technology and Digital Transformation unit,â€ says Vygintas Domarkas, Head of Digital & Technology at Telia Lietuva.
The reduction in workforce is not related to individual employee performance or competencies. The decisions are driven by changes of the unitâ€™s structure and operating model, aimed at improving efficiency and expanding the use of digital solutions across the organisation.
The changes in Telia Lietuva are part of broader changes across Telia Company Group and are also taking place in other Group countries, Group functions and Telia Global Services Lithuania (TGSL). At Group level, structures and operating models are being reviewed to enable clearer ways of working and increased efficiency. At the same time, the changes also include the creation of new opportunities: around 10 new positions are planned to be opened in TGSL and 6 positions in Telia Lietuva, strengthening competencies that are critical for future growth.

Ahead of the changes, comprehensive consultations were held with the Companyâ€™s trade unions within the Digital & Technology unit. These discussions covered the conditions for both departing and remaining employees, possible alternatives, and transition period arrangements. Employees affected by the changes will be provided with appropriate support and fair compensation.
Change in management team
As of 1 February 2026, there will also be changes in the leadership of the Companyâ€™s two units. Elina DapkeviÄienÄ—, currently Head of Consumer at Telia Lietuva, will assume the role of Head of Sales and Customer Service, while Lina BandzinÄ—, who currently leads the Sales and Customer Service unit, will take over as Head of Consumer unit.
In November 2025, Telia Lietuva merged its Technology and Digital Transformation units as well as Legal and Personnel units, further simplifying the organisational structure and seeking to increase operational efficiency.

Darius DÅ¾iaugys,
Head of Investor Relations,
tel. +370 5 236 7878,
e-mail: darius.dziaugys@telia.lt

news.Title: Apple's CEO Recently Invested in Nike. Should You Do the Same?
news.Content:
AAPL

Key Points Tim Cook bought $3 million of Nike stock recently, adding to his existing position.
Nike has been struggling badly in recent years due to inflation, tariffs, and rising competition.
Its new CEO, Elliott Hill, has been on the job for a little over a year.
10 stocks we like better than Nike â€º
Turnaround attempts are challenging in the best of times. Amid economic uncertainty, they can be much more daunting.

That's the situation Nike (NYSE: NKE) finds itself in today. New CEO Elliott Hill is working on improving relationships with key partners and reenergizing the brand, and it comes at a time when consumers are struggling with rising costs and where high-priced apparel may not be a top priority.
One executive who is a believer in the company's turnaround efforts, however, is Apple CEO Tim Cook. Cook recently boosted his position in Nike by purchasing $3 million in additional shares, nearly doubling his stake in the business.
Is this a positive sign for the stock, and should you also consider buying shares of Nike today?
Nike's business is still struggling Hill took over as Nike's CEO in October 2024. It's been over a year since then, and there unfortunately hasn't been significant progress for investors to point to as proof that the business is going in the right direction. Turnarounds can take considerable time, especially when there are significant factors to consider, such as economic ones like tariffs , that are out of the company's control.
Nike's revenue has been fairly stagnant, with the only positive being that the top line didn't go on a big decline in the most recent quarter. But earnings plummeted by 32% in the period ended Nov. 30, 2025, from $1.2 billion a year ago to $792 million. A big part of the reason is that the company's gross margin has been declining as tariffs weigh on Nike's costs.

Why Cook's purchase of Nike stock shouldn't impact your decision Cook has a net worth of $2.6 billion and is the CEO of one of the most valuable companies in the world. For Cook, investing an additional $3 million in Nike's stock may be a worthwhile risk to take on, given his financial position. Every investor has their own goals and financial situation to consider. This is why following the moves of billionaires, whether it's Tim Cook or Warren Buffett, may not be practical, as they can afford to take risks that an average investor can't.

At the end of the day, Cook has access to the same information that anyone else does about Nike's business. And if you're feeling as bullish on Nike's prospects as Cook is and are willing to take on the risk, then perhaps it may be a good move to consider following suit and investing in the business. But another CEO investing in a company is by no means a sign that the stock is a good or safe buy.

Story Continues
Why I'd avoid Nike's stock for now If it were as simple as fixing relationships with vendors and coming up with new styles, I could see Nike being a good stock to invest in, given its popular brand. But I believe its issues go far deeper. There are a growing number of cheap options in apparel these days, and consumers may not see the value in paying more for Nike's brand anymore. While there may be loyalists who are willing to pay more, that is not likely to be the case for the average consumer who may be looking at more cost-effective options.

Nike needs to prove to investors that it's still a growth business, because right now, it isn't. The apparel stock has lost more than half of its value in the past five years, and with profits continuing to plunge, the stock still looks expensive at 38 times its trailing earnings.
Things could get much worse for Nike before they get better, assuming they improve at all. That's why taking a wait-and-see approach may be the safest option with the stock.

news.Title: Silver Briefly Overtakes NVIDIA: What the Rally Could Signal for Bitcoin
news.Content:
NVDA

GC=F

BTC-USD

Silver surged to $82.7 per ounce in early Asian trading hours, nearing its recent all-time high (ATH). The precious metal briefly overtook NVIDIA to become the worldâ€™s second-largest asset by market capitalization.
The move has drawn significant attention across financial markets. Analysts are increasingly comparing silver to Bitcoin, with some suggesting the cryptocurrency could be poised for a similar breakout.

Precious Metal Rally Elevates Silver Above Tech Giant Following a modest correction from its previous all-time high, silver extended its gains beyond $80 per ounce, reaching a high of $82.7 today. The latest rally pushed silverâ€™s market capitalization above NVIDIAâ€™s $4.55 trillion.
At press time, the precious metal was trading at $80.8, up nearly 12% year to date. These gains even outpace gold, which has risen around 3.2% so far in 2026.
Silverâ€™s outperformance is not a recent development. Even in 2025, the metal exceeded gold's advance, rising approximately 176% over the year, compared with a 70.3% gain in gold.
Market observers attribute silver's strength to its dual role. Investors buy it as a monetary or safe-haven asset, similar to gold.
On the other hand, silver plays a critical role in industrial applications, particularly in electronics, solar panels, artificial intelligence hardware, and electric vehicles. BeInCrypto recently highlighted that industrial demand accounts for approximately half of global silver consumption.
According to the analyst , a persistent supply-demand imbalance has fueled silver's rally. The Silver Institute reported that the global silver market saw its fifth straight annual deficit in 2025. Annual demand stands at approximately 1.2 billion ounces, while mine production and recycling only supply around 1 billion ounces.
This structural shortfall has helped sustain upward momentum, with many market participants forecasting that silver could reach triple-digit prices in 2026.
https://twitter.com/wmiddelkoop/status/2008534045135958103?s=20
However, when demand consistently exceeds supply, prices typically rise until consumption begins to decline, a process known as demand destruction. In silverâ€™s case, higher prices could eventually make certain industrial uses uneconomic.

Story Continues
Bitcoin Analysts See Silver Parallels Silverâ€™s record rally has prompted many cryptocurrency market analysts to examine Bitcoinâ€™s chart. Merlijn The Trader observed that silver completed a multi-year cup-and-handle formation ahead of its surge.
The post suggests Bitcoin is now in a similar phase, quietly building the same structure on the weekly chart. The implication is that, as with silver, once this pattern completes, Bitcoin could break out sharply to the upside.
Analyst Crypto Rover added that gold and silver surged sharply after breaking out of their monthly accumulation zones. According to the analyst, Bitcoin has yet to confirm a similar breakout, but once it does, it could trigger a powerful catch-up rally.

Market participants are also watching for a potential capital rotation from precious metals into Bitcoin. When and if such a shift materializes remains to be seen.
Read original story Silver Briefly Overtakes NVIDIA: What the Rally Could Signal for Bitcoin by Kamina Bashir at beincrypto.com

news.Title: New release 'Ballot: When Fate Called Their Name' tells a tale of youth, loyalty, and the hidden cost of war
news.Content:
This is a paid press release. Contact the press release distributor directly with any inquiries.

New release 'Ballot: When Fate Called Their Name' tells a tale of youth, loyalty, and the hidden cost of war

PR Newswire
Tue, January 6, 2026 at 10:00 PM PST 3 min read

Dan Mulvagh exposes Australia's Vietnam War conscription â€” and the fate of those lives changed by a lottery draw
AUCKLAND, New Zealand , Jan. 7, 2026 /PRNewswire/ -- Author Dan Mulvagh returns to the literary scene with the release of " Ballot: When Fate Called Their Name " (published by Xlibris NZ), a thought-provoking novel that sheds light on the personal struggles of a generation caught between opposing political and philosophical worldviews.
Set in the late 1960s, the story opens as four young men â€” Mitch Masters, Jay Petrovich, Greg Sunderland, and Kiwi Parata â€” watch their birth dates tumble from a televised lottery barrel, sealing their futures as conscripts in Australia's Vietnam War. What begins as a test of courage in the jungle evolves into a mystery that stretches across decades and continents. When Jay, the son of Russian refugees fluent in his parents' language, is captured and handed over to Soviet forces, rumors of Australian prisoners in the USSR ignite questions no government dares answer.

Combining historical accuracy with fast-paced storytelling, "Ballot: When Fate Called Their Name" examines how ideology, identity and allegiance collide when choice is stripped away. "It's not a war story per-se," Mulvagh describes. "It goes beyond the horror of combat, and explores the oscillations of xenophobic and patriotic pressures experienced by a generation in the 60s and 70s and 80s, the collisions of ingrained world-views, of allegiance and identity, of mateship that transcends decades, continents, and opposing political and social philosophies. It entertains and provokes simultaneously."
"Ballot: When Fate Called Their Name" is a deeply human exploration of fate, friendship and resilience that resonate far beyond its time and place. It is an invitation for readers to confront the uneasy parallels between past and present â€” from the Cold War to today's geopolitical rifts. The book is available in print and digital formats and may be purchased directly through https://www.xlibris.com/en-nz/bookstore/bookdetails/868235-ballot .

"Ballot: When Fate Called Their Name"
By Dan Mulvagh
Hardcover | 6 x 9in | 366 pages | ISBN 9781669882763
Softcover | 6 x 9in | 366 pages | ISBN 9781669882756
E-Book | 366 pages | ISBN 9781669882749
Available at Amazon and Barnes & Noble
About the Author
Dan Mulvagh was born in Cornwall, England, raised on the Channel Island of Guernsey, and now resides on the rural fringe of Auckland, New Zealand. A lifelong traveler who has lived in Australia, Hong Kong, and Papua New Guinea, Mulvagh draws on rich global experiences and a deep interest in military history to craft stories that entertain and provoke reflection. Known for his meticulous research and cinematic storytelling, he is also the author of "Where the Truth Was Buried." For more information, visit www.danmulvaghauthor.com .

Story Continues
Xlibris Publishing New Zealand , an Author Solutions, LLC imprint, is a self-publishing services provider dedicated to serving the needs of Kiwi authors. By focusing on the needs of creative writers and artists and adopting the latest print-on-demand publishing technology and strategies, we provide expert publishing services with direct and personal access to quality publication in hardcover, trade paperback, custom leather-bound and full-color formats. To date, Xlibris has helped to publish more than 60,000 titles. For more information, visit xlibrispublishing.com.au or call 0-800-008-756 to receive a free publishing guide

news.Title: Samsung Reimagines the Future of Design at CES 2026, Guiding Technology for Humanity
news.Content:
This is a paid press release. Contact the press release distributor directly with any inquiries.

Samsung Reimagines the Future of Design at CES 2026, Guiding Technology for Humanity

PR Newswire
Tue, January 6, 2026 at 9:57 PM PST 4 min read

The concluding session of Samsung's CES 2026 Tech Forum series highlighted the human side of technology with leading designers
LAS VEGAS , Jan. 7, 2026 /PRNewswire/ -- Samsung Electronics, Co., Ltd. today held the final session in its CES 2026 Tech Forum series, 'The Human Side of Tech: Designing a Future Worth Living,' at Samsung's The First Look space at The Wynn Las Vegas. The panel, moderated by Debbie Millman, host of 'Design Matters,' featured Samsung Chief Design Officer Mauro Porcini and industry-leading designers Karim Rashid and Fabio Novembre.
With minimalism having defined the visual language of the tech industry for the past two decades, this panel of designers convened by Samsung asked: What comes next? Together, the panelists explored how warmer, more expressive and emotionally resonant technology can shape meaningful experiences in today's AI era, while also charting a path forward for the industry.

Design as an Act of Love
The session covered a shared view on the purpose of design as fundamentally people-first. "In recent years, design in tech has been somewhat uniform," said moderator Debbie Millman. "Compared to other industries, the uniformity in the world of tech is an anomaly. So what if we were to extend technology beyond specifications and functionality?"
Samsung is currently addressing this question by introducing meaning beyond products by focusing on how technology fits into people's lives, experiences and needs. The panelists discussed the growing importance of this mindset in the current landscape in which traditional barriers to entry such as access to tools, scale and technical capability continue to diminish.

The Human Side of Tech
The discussion highlighted technology's role in making intention, care and humanity visible in everyday life. Panelists noted that technology should help people recognize the thoughtfulness embedded in the products they invite into their homes and routines.
In this context, Samsung Chief Design Officer Mauro Porcini shared Samsung's design purpose: to enrich the quality of people's lives through meaningful technology designed for humanity. He outlined the company's commitment to help people live longer, live better, live louder and live on through advanced technologies that support wellbeing, creativity and self-expression.
Panelist Karim Rashid added to this sentiment, saying, "When we think about physical things in our world, we think not only about diversity of choice but also the fact that we can develop strong connections to objects," he said. "Through design, you can end up with a very powerful, emotional connection with inanimate objects, or even products."

Story Continues
Designing for Human Values
The panel went on to explore how AI can unlock new possibilities for expression when shaped by human values. Panelists discussed a shared view that AI reaches its true potential when guided by Emotional Intelligence and Human Imagination, not as a replacement for human creativity but as a force that expands it.

CDO Porcini articulated this with "AI Ã— (EI + HI)," his approach to balancing Emotional Intelligence and Human Imagination to bring meaning to innovation. While describing this philosophy, CDO Porcini said, "When we design and develop, AI is amplified by Emotional Intelligence and Human Imagination. Then, when people use products, AI amplifies Emotional Intelligence and Human Imagination." He added, "Do not fear technology. We are here to humanize it, guide it, and shape it."
Through these insights, the session reinforced the belief that technology should be humanized, guided and shaped to serve people's lives in increasingly new and meaningful ways.
Expressive Design Drives More Meaningful Experiences
The discussion reinforced the importance of expressive design in bringing human-centered purpose to life, creating experiences that reflect emotion, support self-expression, invite connection and stimulate imagination.

"Happiness is the aim of design," said Fabio Novembre. "Our pursuit of happiness is through design, making the impossible possible. I strongly believe in design, and that it must move back to the center of the stage."
Panelists noted that this reflects a shift from merely designing objects to designing experiences where emotion, meaning and identity are increasingly integral to how people relate to technology. This approach inspires a new kind of expression, resulting in designs that range from subtle and minimal to bold and imaginative â€” all meant to shape a future that isn't just worth living, but worth loving.
About Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.
Samsung inspires the world and shapes the future with transformative ideas and technologies. The company is redefining the worlds of TVs, digital signage, smartphones, wearables, tablets, home appliances and network systems, as well as memory, system LSI and foundry. Samsung is also advancing medical imaging technologies, HVAC solutions and robotics, while creating innovative automotive and audio products through Harman. With its SmartThings ecosystem, open collaboration with partners, and integration of AI across its portfolio, Samsung delivers a seamless and intelligent connected experience. For the latest news, please visit the Samsung Newsroom at news.samsung.com .

news.Title: Bitcoin miners chase AI demand as Nvidia says Rubin is already in production
news.Content:
BTC-USD

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the companyâ€™s next-generation Vera Rubin platform is already in â€œfull production,â€ unveiling fresh details at the CES tech event in Las Vegas about hardware that he says can deliver five times the artificial-intelligence computing of Nvidiaâ€™s previous systems.
Rubin is expected to arrive later this year and is aimed squarely at the fastest-growing part of the AI business, helping to deliver outputs from trained models.

Huang said Rubinâ€™s flagship server will include 72 of Nvidiaâ€™s graphics processing units and 36 central processors, and can be linked into larger â€œpodsâ€ containing more than 1,000 Rubin chips.
Much of the talk was about efficiency. Huang said Rubin systems could improve the efficiency of generating AI â€œtokensâ€ â€” the basic units produced by language models â€” by roughly 10 times, helped by a proprietary type of data the company wants the broader industry to adopt. He added that the performance jump comes despite only a 1.6-times increase in transistor count.
Huang described AI development as a race where faster processing means reaching the next milestone sooner, forcing competitors to spend aggressively on chips, networking and storage.
How bitcoin miners are impacted That same infrastructure race has been reshaping parts of the crypto market too.
Bitcoin miners have increasingly marketed themselves as power-and-rackspace operators rather than pure crypto plays, pitching their energy contracts, cooling capacity and data-center footprints to AI customers.
Hosting AI workloads can generate steadier cash flows than bitcoin mining during down cycles, especially for firms with cheap power, existing sites and cooling capacity.

But the AI boom also raises the bar. Data-center space is becoming a premium asset, and the best sites get bid up by hyperscalers, cloud firms and AI startups.
That can lift rents, equipment costs and financing hurdles for smaller miners. In other words, miners that look like infrastructure companies may win, while those that rely on pure mining margins face a tougher 2026.
Meanwhile, Nvidia also highlighted new networking switches using a connection method called co-packaged optics, a key technology for linking thousands of machines into a single system.
The company said CoreWeave will be among the first to receive Rubin systems, and expects Microsoft, Oracle, Amazon and Alphabet to adopt them as well.
